location.merchant_description_html: The folks at Fazenda may have pulled an Inception on me, because this is my café dream come true. On Level 1, Sweets like Vegan Chocolate Cake and Pumpkin Whoopie Pie are baked in-house every morning. Latin American and African coffee beans are roasted daily for the freshest possible brew. When there’s time to enter Level 2, I bring my totem, the Lemon Pepper Tofu sandwich with hummus, olive tapenade, green pepper, and spinach on a warm ciabatta roll. An elegant solution for keeping track of reality.

Suffering with illness, unable to afford treatment under Scrooge’s miserliness, Tiny Tim wanted to change things for the better once he was healthy. After collecting his royalties from A Christmas Carol, he opened Tiny’s Giant Sandwich shop, bringing the gift of health and prosperity to all with giant sandwiches at tiny prices. Meat lovers kneel in praise at tasty turkey and bacon creations. Vegetarians will find plenty of options, including the Big Mack Daddy loaded veggie burger. It’s a munchie miracle!

Behold, the Reuben! Its origins may be a mystery, hidden underneath layers of ‘kraut, but its popularity has made it a sandwich of the people. And while Seattle may not be the birthplace of the delicatessen, NYC Deli Market serves up a meaty, cheesy, Russian dressing-filled Reuben on rye fit for George Costanza. There’s an extensive, fresh deli menu and popular soup/sandwich combo for those with outside interests. Close your eyes and sink your teeth into a toasty tower of sandwich. Yes, that’s what a deli lunch tastes like sans the cigarette-hot pretzel-knish-scented air of a certain East Coast metropolis.

Though it’s beans and leaves are undoubtedly the tasties in the FiDi, it’s the cafe’s 5 signature Chicken Salad sandwiches that put their lunch offerings on the map. And, when you inquire about them, the smiley sandwich master will rattle them off as if she’s reciting the presidents in order of best hairline. “Tarragon, Mediterranean, Rainbow, Curry, Southwest,” she says-songs. Go for the Rainbow, a unique chicken salad made with red and green apples, dried cranberries, parsley and corn. The colorful crunch can make your day, especially when it’s piled high on onion focaccia.

In the morning, there’s another protein on the scene: eggs. The Bean & Leaf is also open for breakfast serving eggs 3 ways: sandwiches, plates and omelets.

The menu roster at Prima Cafe reads like a who’s who of the gourmet food world. Which delicious brands have descended on the SOMA district?  Leading the beverage menu is the one, the only,  illy Coffee. Iced or hot...drip or americano, illy has your cup covered. There’s a similar AM power player manning the pastry case. It’s none other than the macaron master: City Baking Co. Over on the sandwich board, loaves of Panorama Bread and stacks of Boar’s Head Meat collaborate over lunch. The tag team effort really pays off in the form of the pickle carrot-topped Vietnamese Pork Sandwich. We could brand name-drop all day, but we digress. Eat at Prima Cafe, clearly they utilize the best of the best.

We’re not going to blow steam into your mug. There IS an overpopulation of tea establishments on University Way. BUT, this one is different. Let the information seeping begin... At Tea Republik, you’re not restricted to a certain style. Loose leaf tea is on jar display, stretching the length of the place. Order robust Oolongs and calming greens by the pot. There’s plenty to share. If you don’t want to tango with teacups and kettles, order a tea infused beverage. We’re partial to the Tropical Rain Forest, only because it goes so well with the decor. Under the roof of the indoor tiki bar, you can sip the serene juice-tea mocktail muddled with limes, loaded with apple slices and served on the rocks. #Paradise

A loud, stern and noticeably Italian voice booms over your corner office. “It’s 12PM, do you know where your employees are?” Not in the mood for an adult amber alert, you respond, “Figaro’s. It’s where they go everyday.” Wrong move. James Earl Jonesin-for-a-fight boomed back in retaliation. “Why aren’t YOU there? Do you not enjoy fresh-baked focaccia? Do you not appreciate iced coffee cooled by miniature coffee ice cubes? Do you not savor roll-ups like the Sonny Corleone, dangerously packed with marinated chicken and peppered, ronied and cheesed to the brim?” You have no counter attack, you just grab your coat. Man, having a life narrator is fun, until he gets hungry. Thankfully he has good taste.

Finale is an award-winning desserterie and bakery that’s been delighting sweet toothed Bostonians for years. They are firm believers that indulgence is a dish best served on dramatically arranged plates. Thanks to overhanging mirrors at the plating station, you can catch a bird’s eye view of the artistry in motion. You’ll watch, mouth-watering, as the chef plants fresh fruit atop the perfectly singed vanilla surface of the Crème Brûlée. You’ll grip your chair when a Molten Chocolate Cake comes into view. The almond-topped beauty holds a warm and gooey center that’s been known to provoke dessert envy. Are the decadent desserts as delicious as they look? The proof’s in the Varhona chocolate. Translation: absolutely.

They are firm believers that indulgence is a dish best served on dramatically arranged plates. Thanks to overhanging mirrors at the plating station, you can catch a bird’s eye view of the artistry in motion. The almond-topped beauty holds a warm and gooey center that’s been known to provoke dessert envy. Are the decadent desserts as delicious as they look? The proof’s in the Varhona chocolate. Translation: absolutely.

Sometimes, going out to eat isn’t as meaningful as a family meal around your own dinner table. For the ingredients for a memorable home-cooked meal, head to the butchers at Savenor’s Market. The USDA Prime Rib Roast will make a beautiful centerpiece, and the marbled texture gives way to robust flavor. Back in her day, Julia Child would frequent Savenor’s for her cooking needs. The store is stocked with fresh products: sirloin, bacon, cheese and beans, even marinades. Let’s be honest... if it’s good enough for Julia, it’ll make for an astoundingly flavorful reason for your family to come together.

Shopping for the daily necessities is all about efficiency. My one-stop, knock-out-my-grocery-list store is Nicolas Market & Deli. It’s kind of like a mini Supermarket Sweep. I snatch up a bag of cat food before nabbing a roll of tape. I secure them, then sprint for the deli counter, ordering up finely sliced ham and hole-y slices of Swiss. Next, I jet on to snag some paper towels and... oh, a heavy 24-pack of Heineken. Thinking quick, I slide it to the counter, pile my winnings on top and yell, “TIME!” The store owner clocks me at a slick 4 mins and 27 secs. Efficiency is my middle name.

Moms and savvy sitters, take note. All Fired Up! is a paint-your-own-pottery place that needs to be filed under “crowd pleasing day-tivties” immediately. Swing by and choose from over 400 paintable items including piggy banks, treasure boxes and trinkets of all kinds.The studio is fully stocked with paint, brushes, sponges and stencils to make your visit as creative as possible. To get painting, just pay a sitting fee, $6 (12 and under) or $8 (12 and over.) The sitting fee is per visit, not per piece or hour. So, you can paint as many pieces as your mini Monet likes!

PS--I’ve got three words for you: BYOB Diva Nights. Say it with me, “I will stay in the lines. I will stay in the lines.”

I got away with impersonating Wolverine during the colder months, but now it’s time for some serious maintenance. My cuticles are rebelling and my hair is on strike (“resist the brush!”) It’s gonna take some magic to tame this. I head straight to Verde Salon. I look down their hair menu of up-dos, extensions and cuts until I find what I need... coloring. When I leave the hair chair, I shellac-it up before the real maintenance: an all-out wax. After that, I totally earned my deep-tissue Zen Massage. I leave Verde in full post-hibernation hotness mode. Wolverine, who? Just call me “fox.”

My co-worker is destroying my lunchtime mojo with his boring turkey sandwich. I slapped it to the floor and jerked a thumb towards the door with a menacing glare. We’re off to find the Asian Persuasion food truck. I did the ordering. Spicy pork Bangkok Sliders on warm Hawaiian bread for him. Tortilla-cradled FOB Tacos for me, loaded with panko-breaded fish, Asian slaw and spicy mayo. After a few bites he was hooked. I let him know... if I ever see that lame sandwich again, I’m hitting him with a swift Firecracker Shrimp roundhouse kick. See what’s poppin’ with the art of Asian Persuasion @AsianFoodTruck.

Ada’s Technical Books is cementing Capitol Hill’s geek-chic reputation. Shelved with tech, math and science-centric reads, this locally-owned shop lures decorated intellectuals and curious thinkers alike. Swing by to peruse (there are plenty of nooks to hack) or pop by with a purpose (the expert curators can help you find any obscurity.) What good is a paperback palace without a stiff beverage? Since coffee is for the common bookster, Ada’s doles out a beverage fit for a scientist. Club-Mate is a heavily caffeinated soda-tea hybrid. And, Ada’s is the only place you can nab it in Washington. #RareFind.

“Cheeburger! Cheeburger!” That’s the response I get from my kids when I ask what they want for dinner. So I place my hand theatrically on my hip and shoot a stern look of disapproval their way, all the while I’m salivating at the thought of a cold beer and a half-pound 100% Angus burger with my choice of toppings. At this point, I’m only fooling myself. Finally, the thought crispy fries and zesty horseradish dipping sauce puts me over the edge, and I succumb, “just this once.”

Lucid dreaming: it’s a fantasy I control. I swoop into Lakeview at 2AM on Saturday (I’m an owl in my dreams,) and start to build my perfect slice. Pie Hole Pizza Joint has all the tools: caramelized onions, red pesto sauce and a 6-cheese blend of mozzarella, provolone, cheddar, gouda, feta and parmesan. My mind is spinning, my taste buds twerking. The kids next to me are eating the After-School Special: sausage, cheese and marshmallows. I’ll dream of breakfast next...

Coco Jazz Salon in University City is a place of restoration and relaxation, but it’s also the place you go to when you wanna make a bold statement! Switch things up with a cut that’s sassy, short and sleek. If you want to take it down a notch, the weave techs can rapunzel your hairstyle so you leave with long, luscious locks. From hair coloring to a basic wash, dry and curl, all of your hair needs will be met and exceeded. Each style does come with a warning though: it’s easy to trip over all those jaws that are still on the floor, so watch your step honey.

Don’t call it a comeback. Cupcakes never went out of style. Especially not Root Beer frosted Sugar Cookie Cupcakes from the Atlanta Cupcake Factory. With a fresh recipe and a knack for small-batch baking, the family-owned company is cranking up the confectionery heat. At $2.75 per cup, you’ll want to grab an array of classics (think Red Velvet) as well as some wildly inventive sweets (Chocolate Bacon Peanut Butter!) But take heed, the bakery often sells out, so come early!

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Since 1969 the DiBartolo family has been making the frosting fantasies of Collingswood cake lovers a reality. Sweet dreams at the bakery have been known to involve confectionery renderings like neon-laced Nike sneakers, dark and ominous Batman insignias and more traditional Tres Leches cakes. There are also plenty of single-serving confections like cookies, macarons and chocolate-frosted, cream-filled donuts to grab on the go. Though...we wouldn’t judge if you staged a faux engagement in order to order one of the white-laced wedding themed cakes.

Like any great city, Boston has a laundry list of inarguable staples. The Red Sox. Traffic. The Freedom Trail. Dirty water. Harvard. Pak the cah in Havad yad. Dennis Leary. And of course, seafood. Now there’s a tradition everyone can get behind. In fact, I know a place where the “Best in Boston” chowda comes in a fluffy bread bowl and the lobsters come fresh from Maine. Family owned and operated since 1987, the shop’s dedication to speedy seafood continues to keep them at the top of mind for lunch and dinner. Tourist or townie, claw cracker or soup sipper, there’s a dish for you at Boston Chowda. In the city? Head to the Pru location. North shoring it? North Andover is your shop!

Uno Dué Go is a marketplace restaurant with the best ingredient intentions. Heat up your lunch break with a locally-grown Harvest Vegetable stone-oven Pizza. Every speck of the salsa-ed surface is covered in lush broccoli, crisp peppers, aromatic basil and a hearty heap of cheese. What could top that? Only a sweet, sweet trip to the Greek Yogurt bar. Though the place is brimming with afternoon cravings, it’s never too early for a Uno Dué Go detour. The doors open at 6:30AM. And, a yawn is a just silent scream for coffee...organic fair-trade coffee.

Why be forced to decide among multiple good options? I prefer to live life like a hot buffet: indulge in a little bit of everything. Enter the New Asia on the block. I pile my plate with Spring Rolls, Spare Ribs, Dumplings, Rangoon and Mein (Lo and Chow.) But in order to keep indulging in all of life’s pleasures, it’s imperative to maintain a sensible budget. Sometimes I prefer to live life a la carte. That way I get exactly what I want: Roast Pork Egg Rolls ($1.20,) Wonton Soup ($1.40,) and Veggie Fried Rice ($3.25.)

Alright, rock-paper-scissors for who drives to Java Supreme. Wait, new game? Let’s hear it. A soy latte drowns falafel. Falafel crumbles pesto pasta. Pesto pasta out-scents free Wi-Fi. Wait a minute, in what world does falafel beat pesto pasta? Um, the one where the falafel is vegan, made-with-hummus and over-stuffed into a warm pita with veggies. Well how are we going to leave out the sandwich-salad combo for $5.50? Easy, that’s for when you don’t care who drives; you just want to get here ASAP, duh!

Nervously, I approach the Fond cake at Belle Cakery. I’ve had my share of tempting desserts here... delicate Brown Butter Apple Tartlets, hand-kneaded Olive Bread. But the Fond cake is something special. I blush as a slice reveals a side profile of its sweet layers: a strip of malted milk chocolate mousse. A sheet of cocoa sponge cake balanced on a crisp peanut base. Finally, a stratum of peanut butter-chocolate ganache. I stammer. “Would it be okay... can I... have a slice?” I enjoyed its layers under the cherry blossom tree outside. Maybe if I take home a whole cake, this feeling will last forever.

When the sun comes up, you can greet it in two ways: hurl vicious expletives towards the sky (and your alarm) or get revved up for breakfast at Julia’s of Wallingford. Sit on the patio and start off with Cinnamon Yum Yum buns: fresh from the on-site bakery and dipped in goey l’orange cream. Stay for dinner, or migrate to JW’s wild twin sister, Julia’s on Broadway! Friday nights call for dinner & the Le Faux show, featuring celebrity impersonators and drag queens! Throw back a few drinks, dance with divas and be sure to be on your worst behavior... Just remember who the REAL queens of the stage are!

FORE! Speeding toward the streets of Seattle like an off-kilter golf ball is Happy Grillmore, a burger-based food truck with a delicious menu named after Sandler sidekicks. The Chubs is not gator-based, but the angus beef burg does pack a hell of a bite with red pepper aioli and spicy mustard. Cue the antagonist! Weighing in at ¼ lb. is The Shooter Burger. Just like McGavin, it’s ridiculously aggressive. Granted it is a black bean burger, you know...to stay trim for the Pro Golf Tour. Even when you pile on a side fries, Bob Barker will tell you that the price is right. Track the truck, we guarantee that it will make you...Happy.

Asa Sushi has created its own language to deliver original works of art from their counter to your mouth. For instance, did you know that “OMG” translates to deep fried unagi, crab and avocado with shrimp, tuna and spicy scallop? Or that the risqué sounding Booty Booty roll holds tuna, crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, and cream cheese? For those seeking familiar vocab, there’s plentiful udon, donburi and teriyaki. But then, what better way to honor your city than a yellowtail, scallion and tobiko translated Golden Gate Roll?

Downtown dwellers, did you know that you can capitalize on quick service sushi and eclectic entrees at Ai Sushi? The convenient lunch location serves Japanese food from 10:30AM-3PM on weekdays. Eel fans will get excited about the Caterpillar Rolls that are shrouded in bright avocado while adventurous eaters will be clamoring to try a Stuffed Orange Roll, stuffed with spiced baby lobster, masago, salmon and veggies. If you consider raw fish a foe, check out the entree menu. Dishes like Chicken Teriyaki, Curry Katsu and Shrimp Tempura come in full servings and convenient half-bowl servings known as “minis.”

Don’t fret, I know it’s overwhelming. A rainbow of ingredients mimics the shades of a rack of American Apparel tees. Whatever you choose, your salad will be unique. Vibrant reds pop through peppers. Deep purple beets complement the yellows of fresh corn and slices of fresh avocado that you can taste just by gazing at. Add proteins like mouth-popping creole shrimp, grilled chicken or tuna. Don’t worry if you’re not into the greens though; the rainbow can transform into sandwiches, quesadillas, soups and quiche!

When you roll into Philly Styles Hair Studio, make sure to ask for Soul. We’re not talking funky jazz and a stylish cut... all of that goes without saying. We’re talking Soul the barber, the guy known for working wonders with a set of clippers and his own two hands. Settle into his leather chair and let him know exactly what you want, or let his guidance lead you to a cut that best suits you. He’ll line you up, set it off with a fade or give you shape. You can’t trust just anybody with your hair. But with a name like Soul, you’re in good hands, my man.

This is my fantasy. I licked my lips as I watched it unfurl. A massive, 10 inch... tortilla. Yeah, I’m definitely a big Burrito kind of girl, and El Fuego is packing them with marinated treats. “Spicy Beef, Chorizo, Veggies...?” The voice of the server snapped me out of my daze. I chose Chorizo and tacked on Chips & Salsa. When he told me it was Happy Hour from 4-7PM, and that Frozen Margaritas and Beer were specially priced, my knees went. Suddenly, I wondered if a person who could utter such beautiful things could possibly be single. I asked, and he placed the brick-heavy Burrito in my hand in reply. I tried.

As fertile grounds for the exchange of caffeine, food and convention-challenging ideas, it’s no wonder revolutions have always started in coffee houses. Enter WiFi, open mic nights, a book club, documentary screenings, and organic/fair trade goods and we’re overflowing with progressive thinking. Keep the ideas coming by sipping The Speziato, a coconut latte with chocolate, hazelnut and cayenne. Munch on The State and 16th, a croissant topped with peanut butter, banana, and honey. Overflow Coffee Bar, I’m brimming with love for ya.

Potash Markets is a versatile place. It satisfies picky lunchers with delicious made-to-order deli sandwiches and an extensive salad bar. It delights and excites weekend warriors with the promise of beer, wine and liquor to fuel their Saturday shenanigans. And, most interestingly it calms frazzled city dwellers who seek a one-stop errand-shop where they can purchase postage stamps, fill transit cards and cash paychecks. Sure, you can do your grocery shopping there, but that’s a given.

It’s your 5th wedding anniversary, and you’re determined to cook your wife a meal she’ll never forget. You mastered the grilled cheese in college, but you’re not exactly Mario Batali in the kitchen. Not to worry friend, the quality and exotic selection at Sobsey’s Produce will cover up even your most heinous culinary screw ups. It’s Hoboken’s premier destination for glistening fresh produce, high-quality meats and organic goods. If the sum of the parts equal the whole, your meal cannot fail.

The best meals start with ingredients that are individually fresh. But, can something ever be too fresh? At Leaves & Loaves, the problem first surfaced with the Asian Chicken Salad. Wonton crisps, sugar snap peas, almonds and mandarin oranges all came together and they were SO fresh that they slapped a customer straight in the mouth. Tastebuds, down for the count. The freshly-pressed Whole Wheat Crepes egg customers on, taunting them to add more and more fillings like tofu, turkey or buffalo chicken. Steak & Cheese Paninis come in hot, sharp with cheddar. Time to teach that sandwich a lesson, perhaps?

At Chomp N’ Swig, there are over 40 varieties of beer. On the flip, there are only 4 sandwiches up for grabs. But it’s cool... not only is 40:4 a pretty awesome ratio, sandwiches like the Grilled Cheese can also be customized with savory surprises. Ever had a Bacon Butter Crunch + Guac Grilled Cheese? Pair it with a wild brew like the Heretic Evil Cousin Red Ale. If brews aren’t your style, there’s a full-bodied glass of red or a Cappuccino comin’ your way. Yup, they’ve got those too. Just call them Libation Station.

“Oh, France was tres magnifique!” “You haven’t had REAL Italian food until you’ve been to Parma...” My friends look at me to pipe in about my culinary journeys. I describe Fettuccine Alfredo, dotted with sun-dried tomatoes. I tell them about how I agonized over my expertly marinated New York Steak and Prawns, fried golden. When I got around to describing the creamy sips of the Mocha that followed, one of my friends grabbed my arm. “Where IS this place?” I gave her directions... get in you car, drive for a bit, then pull over at SoMa Inn Cafe. It’s American home cooking, made with passion.

Faneuil’s cobblestones may be beautiful, but they are breaking my heel’s soles. I’ve seen too many stilettos leveled, and too many patents scuffed not to have a go-to shoe repair shop. My place is Beacon Hill Instant Shoe Repair. Their speedy service clicks with my hectic schedule. The expertly staffed shop can shine, stretch, waterproof, and repair almost any pair...sometimes WHILE you wait. Don’t watch another pair march down the short path to despair, a little maintenance can go a long way. Walk in M-TH 7:30AM-5:30PM and F from 7:30AM-5PM.

Looking for groceries in Boston is enough to make you go ape. Luckily, there’s a small, family-owned operation stocked with gotta-have-it’s of all kinds including Boar’s Head deli meat, a lush selection of produce and real fruit smoothies. You’ll Go Bananas for the place that keeps your breakfast swimming in cereal, your lunch stacked on fresh bread and your dinner out of the microwave (unless of course you’re in the mood for Easy Mac.)

Looking for a midday pick-me-up but not sure exactly what you need? At City Mini Mart, you’re bound to find the one thing that will set your afternoon off with a snacktime bang. Let your eyes lead you to the prize: the refrigerators are stocked with juices and beverages of every color, grab ‘n go eats and frozen confections. On your way out, the word “Lotto” might just catch your eye. Hey... you were lucky enough to find this little gem. Maybe you’ve got a little luck left in ya?

The Lexus low-riders. The Escalade high-rollers. The versatile Chevy Volt va-va-voomers. Moxie burgers are not for everyone. They’re over the top (with fried and caramelized onions) yet provide options: ground beef, turkey or lamb; grilled chicken or portobello mushroom caps. This hip art-filled eatery truly brings VIP service, where you can enjoy a glass of wine on the patio while the kids play on outdoor chalkboard tables. A gathering place for family and friends, Moxie is high-fare at casual prices.

Cross my heart, to Mariposa I fly. Sink my fork into some pie. Fresh pretzel rolls, that’s all that I can take, but then I see Banana Pistachio Cake. Okay, okay I’ll stay for some more. How’s the Bread Pudding? I’ll try it to be sure. Small batch organic coffee steams like a dream, and with Dried Cherry Biscotti I involuntarily scream. Now I’m in freak-mode, I gotta tell my friends, about their Curry Chicken Salad and breakfast options. Poached Eggs with salsa has my morning blues beat, Mariposa’s the queen bee of these bakery streets.

Listen up guys... the “real men wear pink” movement is more or less widely accepted now, so it’s time for something new: real men do Pilates. Men and women alike flock to The Pilates Soul Studio in Collingswood to strengthen their core, find their flexibility and work their bodies from the inside out. The Studio is fully equipped with all the tools to get your body running like a well-toned machine. Sign up for a 1-on-1 session, TRX suspension training, Pilates machine classes and more. A few classes and six packs later, we’re sure Pilates will be your new thing.

The chefs at Stone Hearth Pizza have mastered the chew, crunch, char ratio in the thin crust of their Neapolitan style pizza, but the crust is not the only star in this oven. The sweet signature sauce, made with organic tomatoes mingles with the cheese and toppings in what we call a “crave-worthy collaboration.” Plus, a slice of this savory pie is just as good for your health as it is for your taste buds. The fresh, organic ingredients are sourced from 30 New England farms and businesses! Round up your family and friends and grab a seat at the table...there’s a fresh pizza with your name on it!

The chefs at Stone Hearth Pizza have mastered the chew, crunch, char ratio in the thin crust of their Neapolitan style pizza, but the crust is not the only star in this oven. The sweet signature sauce, made with organic tomatoes mingles with the cheese and toppings in what we call a “crave-worthy collaboration.” Plus, a slice of this savory pie is just as good for your health as it is for your taste buds. The fresh, organic ingredients are sourced from 30 New England farms and businesses! Round up your family and friends and grab a seat at the table...there’s a fresh pizza with your name on it!

Conveniently located? Check. Fully stocked with assorted beers, wines, and spirits? Check. A friendly and knowledgeable staff? Check. The only thing it is lacking? An Adirondack chair, so I can just shop, sit, and sip. Hey, it’s been a long week! Bars near Boston’s TD Garden tend to be packed with people and chock full of chatter, making even a simple task like ordering a drink an arduous assignment. North Station Liquors stands as an urban oasis; ready to quench your adult thirst. So, skip the bar scene and enjoy your favorite beverage where it always tastes better, from the comfort of your home.

How do they get the Ham Fried Rice to form a perfectly spherical dome at Tara Thai Cuisine? Well... we actually don’t know. But you might as well stop poking at it with your fork and get down to business: no grain left behind. Make sure your rice has a chance to mingle with swirling scoops of Spaghetti Kee Mao. Under a jungle gym of noodles is a world of sauteed broccoli, glimmering bell peppers, onions, sweet basil and your choice of meat. Tara Thai is cooking up food for the fun of it, which deliciously flavorful benefits. Get in on their Happy Hour menu Monday through Friday from 3-6PM and Saturday and Sunday from 12-5PM.

Soldiers, gather at your stations. The patrons will be here soon to dine on our buffet-style delicacies. Men, over to the grill; seal the fate of our customers’ appetites with juice-oozing burgers and homemade potato chips. For those weak from battle, slices of fresh from the oven pizza will replenish in a melted medley of warm cheese and pepperoni. Sea masters, man the sushi station so our people can see the delicious fruits of our labor. Give thanks, men. To Leonidas, to Chicago, for this is CAFE 300!

We’ll let you in on a hefty secret: healthy eats don’t have to leave you feeling hollow. Brookhaven Bistro won’t allow it. Try their signature Salmon Quesadilla layered with Jack cheese and fresh tomatoes. For a crazy kick, ask for the chipotle dipping sauce (you’ll thank us later.) For those who flake when it comes to fish, The Elbow Licker Turkey Burger provide satisfying results. The challenge arrives on Wednesdays, when they serve up Falafel and Shawarma, in their housemade pita. They’re hot commodities and they WILL sell out, so try and beat the rush!

Boston Common Coffee takes a different approach to Mass caffenation. (“Mass” as in Achusetts not mass consumption, that’s not really their style.) Pouring practices are hot, the coffee is fresh-brewed and never burnt. The distinctions don’t stop there. They don’t serve muffins, they serve sugared muffin tops...the tastiest of all muffin anatomy. They don’t believe that cream cheese has to be a plain endeavor and they don’t restrict their lunch menu to sandwiches and salads. Hello quiche! Lastly, there are seating options. High stools, plush couches, traditional tables. Take your pick and let the free wifi flow.

When research proclaimed that dark chocolate is actually GOOD for you, I decided to take a few liberties and regularly include all chocolate into my diet. At Kakao Cafe, they’re all about quality cocoa, delicious drinks and LOTS of space. Choc drinks are made with a Ghirardelli or Valrhona base, or a real bar of your choice. Our suggestion: the Cardamom Hot Chocolate, steaming with subtle flavors. Kakao also serves Herkimer Coffee and a stunning selection of loose-leaf tea. With Nutella Brioche, my day is looking up. Only thing I’m missing is a sweet ending... hello, Vosges Black Salt Caramel Chocolate Bar.

The bouncy sound of Mariachi dances on your eardrums and triggers an instantaneous Pavlovian response. Your stomach growls and your eyes beam. An irresistible craving for pinto beans, Mexican yellow rice, and rich, melt-in-your-mouth Mole Chicken Poblano overcomes you. Weekdays from 11AM-3PM, Ranchito Del Agave offers up one of the most tantalizing lunch buffets in the city where all your South-of-the-border fantasies are fulfilled. Or, go for dinner and get it poppin’ with some Patron Margs!

Living in an über tech trendy town can be exhausting. It’s already bad enough that Apple makes you feel like a jerk for not having the latest and greatest version of the i-something, but how about those fly-by-night restaurants that end up skimping on the quality and relying heavily on the hip? Lucky for you, Fuji sushi serves classic Japanese cuisine; delicious food without all that fusion/derivative/interpretive trendy jive. Your senses will be greeted with old favorites like fresh North Pacific Sashimi, perfectly sliced Beef Sukiyaki, and a colorful array of Makimono. Keep your form of payment cutting edge with LevelUp, but let your food stay classic.

Boston Common Coffee takes a different approach to Mass caffenation. (“Mass” as in Achusetts not mass consumption, that’s not really their style.) Pouring practices are hot, the coffee is fresh-brewed and never burnt. The distinctions don’t stop there. They don’t serve muffins, they serve sugared muffin tops...the tastiest of all muffin anatomy. They don’t believe that cream cheese has to be a plain endeavor and they don’t restrict their lunch menu to sandwiches and salads. Hello quiche! Lastly, there are seating options. High stools, plush couches, traditional tables. Take your pick and let the free wifi flow.

Boston Common Coffee takes a different approach to Mass caffenation. (“Mass” as in Achusetts not mass consumption, that’s not really their style.) Pouring practices are hot, the coffee is fresh-brewed and never burnt. The distinctions don’t stop there. They don’t serve muffins, they serve sugared muffin tops...the tastiest of all muffin anatomy. They don’t believe that cream cheese has to be a plain endeavor and they don’t restrict their lunch menu to sandwiches and salads. Hello quiche! Lastly, there are seating options. High stools, plush couches, traditional tables. Take your pick and let the free wifi flow.

The ship has dropped its anchor, and let’s hope it never leaves: Cugini Café’s successor has boatloads of the good stuff. The Anchored Ship’s wanderlust means they’re brewing Herkimer coffee and espresso alongside multiple Seattle-sourced treats; if Macrina pastries, Sweet Treats cookies and Bouteloua Bakery aren’t reeling you in, what about Sister Souls Baking Co.’s gluten-free loaves and a fresh juice? Drink down your latte with a fisherman’s gusto, and contemplate your return to the Seattle Seas. All aboard!

The only thing that’s standard about Universal Cutz is the red, white and blue barbershop swirl that marks the Baltimore Avenue shop. Everything else about the haircut experience here is custom. Whether you’re coming in for an all over cut or you just need a quick line-up, your head is in good hands. Troy and his staff of expert shearsman are ready to help you reach your fresh potential. They even open early on Saturdays at 8AM to ensure that you look right for a big night out.

The folks at Fazenda may have pulled an Inception on me, because this is my café dream come true. On Level 1, Sweets like Vegan Chocolate Cake and Pumpkin Whoopie Pie are baked in-house every morning. Latin American and African coffee beans are roasted daily for the freshest possible brew. When there’s time to enter Level 2, I bring my totem, the Lemon Pepper Tofu sandwich with hummus, olive tapenade, green pepper, and spinach on a warm ciabatta roll. An elegant solution for keeping track of reality.

Suffering with illness, unable to afford treatment under Scrooge’s miserliness, Tiny Tim wanted to change things for the better once he was healthy. After collecting his royalties from A Christmas Carol, he opened Tiny’s Giant Sandwich shop, bringing the gift of health and prosperity to all with giant sandwiches at tiny prices. Meat lovers kneel in praise at tasty turkey and bacon creations. Vegetarians will find plenty of options, including the Big Mack Daddy loaded veggie burger. It’s a munchie miracle!

Behold, the Reuben! Its origins may be a mystery, hidden underneath layers of ‘kraut, but its popularity has made it a sandwich of the people. And while Seattle may not be the birthplace of the delicatessen, NYC Deli Market serves up a meaty, cheesy, Russian dressing-filled Reuben on rye fit for George Costanza. There’s an extensive, fresh deli menu and popular soup/sandwich combo for those with outside interests. Close your eyes and sink your teeth into a toasty tower of sandwich. Yes, that’s what a deli lunch tastes like sans the cigarette-hot pretzel-knish-scented air of a certain East Coast metropolis.

Though it’s beans and leaves are undoubtedly the tasties in the FiDi, it’s the cafe’s 5 signature Chicken Salad sandwiches that put their lunch offerings on the map. And, when you inquire about them, the smiley sandwich master will rattle them off as if she’s reciting the presidents in order of best hairline. “Tarragon, Mediterranean, Rainbow, Curry, Southwest,” she says-songs. Go for the Rainbow, a unique chicken salad made with red and green apples, dried cranberries, parsley and corn. The colorful crunch can make your day, especially when it’s piled high on onion focaccia.

In the morning, there’s another protein on the scene: eggs. The Bean & Leaf is also open for breakfast serving eggs 3 ways: sandwiches, plates and omelets.

The menu roster at Prima Cafe reads like a who’s who of the gourmet food world. Which delicious brands have descended on the SOMA district?  Leading the beverage menu is the one, the only,  illy Coffee. Iced or hot...drip or americano, illy has your cup covered. There’s a similar AM power player manning the pastry case. It’s none other than the macaron master: City Baking Co. Over on the sandwich board, loaves of Panorama Bread and stacks of Boar’s Head Meat collaborate over lunch. The tag team effort really pays off in the form of the pickle carrot-topped Vietnamese Pork Sandwich. We could brand name-drop all day, but we digress. Eat at Prima Cafe, clearly they utilize the best of the best.

We’re not going to blow steam into your mug. There IS an overpopulation of tea establishments on University Way. BUT, this one is different. Let the information seeping begin... At Tea Republik, you’re not restricted to a certain style. Loose leaf tea is on jar display, stretching the length of the place. Order robust Oolongs and calming greens by the pot. There’s plenty to share. If you don’t want to tango with teacups and kettles, order a tea infused beverage. We’re partial to the Tropical Rain Forest, only because it goes so well with the decor. Under the roof of the indoor tiki bar, you can sip the serene juice-tea mocktail muddled with limes, loaded with apple slices and served on the rocks. #Paradise

A loud, stern and noticeably Italian voice booms over your corner office. “It’s 12PM, do you know where your employees are?” Not in the mood for an adult amber alert, you respond, “Figaro’s. It’s where they go everyday.” Wrong move. James Earl Jonesin-for-a-fight boomed back in retaliation. “Why aren’t YOU there? Do you not enjoy fresh-baked focaccia? Do you not appreciate iced coffee cooled by miniature coffee ice cubes? Do you not savor roll-ups like the Sonny Corleone, dangerously packed with marinated chicken and peppered, ronied and cheesed to the brim?” You have no counter attack, you just grab your coat. Man, having a life narrator is fun, until he gets hungry. Thankfully he has good taste.

Finale is an award-winning desserterie and bakery that’s been delighting sweet toothed Bostonians for years. They are firm believers that indulgence is a dish best served on dramatically arranged plates. Thanks to overhanging mirrors at the plating station, you can catch a bird’s eye view of the artistry in motion. You’ll watch, mouth-watering, as the chef plants fresh fruit atop the perfectly singed vanilla surface of the Crème Brûlée. You’ll grip your chair when a Molten Chocolate Cake comes into view. The almond-topped beauty holds a warm and gooey center that’s been known to provoke dessert envy. Are the decadent desserts as delicious as they look? The proof’s in the Varhona chocolate. Translation: absolutely.

Finale is an award-winning desserterie and bakery that’s been delighting sweet toothed Bostonians for years. They are firm believers that indulgence is a dish best served on dramatically arranged plates. Thanks to overhanging mirrors at the plating station, you can catch a bird’s eye view of the artistry in motion. You’ll watch, mouth-watering, as the chef plants fresh fruit atop the perfectly singed vanilla surface of the Crème Brûlée. You’ll grip your chair when a Molten Chocolate Cake comes into view. The almond-topped beauty holds a warm and gooey center that’s been known to provoke dessert envy. Are the decadent desserts as delicious as they look? The proof’s in the Varhona chocolate. Translation: absolutely.

Sometimes, going out to eat isn’t as meaningful as a family meal around your own dinner table. For the ingredients for a memorable home-cooked meal, head to the butchers at Savenor’s Market. The USDA Prime Rib Roast will make a beautiful centerpiece, and the marbled texture gives way to robust flavor. Back in her day, Julia Child would frequent Savenor’s for her cooking needs. The store is stocked with fresh products: sirloin, bacon, cheese and beans, even marinades. Let’s be honest... if it’s good enough for Julia, it’ll make for an astoundingly flavorful reason for your family to come together.

Shopping for the daily necessities is all about efficiency. My one-stop, knock-out-my-grocery-list store is Nicolas Market & Deli. It’s kind of like a mini Supermarket Sweep. I snatch up a bag of cat food before nabbing a roll of tape. I secure them, then sprint for the deli counter, ordering up finely sliced ham and hole-y slices of Swiss. Next, I jet on to snag some paper towels and... oh, a heavy 24-pack of Heineken. Thinking quick, I slide it to the counter, pile my winnings on top and yell, “TIME!” The store owner clocks me at a slick 4 mins and 27 secs. Efficiency is my middle name.

Moms and savvy sitters, take note. All Fired Up! is a paint-your-own-pottery place that needs to be filed under “crowd pleasing day-tivties” immediately. Swing by and choose from over 400 paintable items including piggy banks, treasure boxes and trinkets of all kinds.The studio is fully stocked with paint, brushes, sponges and stencils to make your visit as creative as possible. To get painting, just pay a sitting fee, $6 (12 and under) or $8 (12 and over.) The sitting fee is per visit, not per piece or hour. So, you can paint as many pieces as your mini Monet likes!

PS--I’ve got three words for you: BYOB Diva Nights. Say it with me, “I will stay in the lines. I will stay in the lines.”

I got away with impersonating Wolverine during the colder months, but now it’s time for some serious maintenance. My cuticles are rebelling and my hair is on strike (“resist the brush!”) It’s gonna take some magic to tame this. I head straight to Verde Salon. I look down their hair menu of up-dos, extensions and cuts until I find what I need... coloring. When I leave the hair chair, I shellac-it up before the real maintenance: an all-out wax. After that, I totally earned my deep-tissue Zen Massage. I leave Verde in full post-hibernation hotness mode. Wolverine, who? Just call me “fox.”

My co-worker is destroying my lunchtime mojo with his boring turkey sandwich. I slapped it to the floor and jerked a thumb towards the door with a menacing glare. We’re off to find the Asian Persuasion food truck. I did the ordering. Spicy pork Bangkok Sliders on warm Hawaiian bread for him. Tortilla-cradled FOB Tacos for me, loaded with panko-breaded fish, Asian slaw and spicy mayo. After a few bites he was hooked. I let him know... if I ever see that lame sandwich again, I’m hitting him with a swift Firecracker Shrimp roundhouse kick. See what’s poppin’ with the art of Asian Persuasion @AsianFoodTruck.

Ada’s Technical Books is cementing Capitol Hill’s geek-chic reputation. Shelved with tech, math and science-centric reads, this locally-owned shop lures decorated intellectuals and curious thinkers alike. Swing by to peruse (there are plenty of nooks to hack) or pop by with a purpose (the expert curators can help you find any obscurity.) What good is a paperback palace without a stiff beverage? Since coffee is for the common bookster, Ada’s doles out a beverage fit for a scientist. Club-Mate is a heavily caffeinated soda-tea hybrid. And, Ada’s is the only place you can nab it in Washington. #RareFind.

“Cheeburger! Cheeburger!” That’s the response I get from my kids when I ask what they want for dinner. So I place my hand theatrically on my hip and shoot a stern look of disapproval their way, all the while I’m salivating at the thought of a cold beer and a half-pound 100% Angus burger with my choice of toppings. At this point, I’m only fooling myself. Finally, the thought crispy fries and zesty horseradish dipping sauce puts me over the edge, and I succumb, “just this once.”

Lucid dreaming: it’s a fantasy I control. I swoop into Lakeview at 2AM on Saturday (I’m an owl in my dreams,) and start to build my perfect slice. Pie Hole Pizza Joint has all the tools: caramelized onions, red pesto sauce and a 6-cheese blend of mozzarella, provolone, cheddar, gouda, feta and parmesan. My mind is spinning, my taste buds twerking. The kids next to me are eating the After-School Special: sausage, cheese and marshmallows. I’ll dream of breakfast next...

Coco Jazz Salon in University City is a place of restoration and relaxation, but it’s also the place you go to when you wanna make a bold statement! Switch things up with a cut that’s sassy, short and sleek. If you want to take it down a notch, the weave techs can rapunzel your hairstyle so you leave with long, luscious locks. From hair coloring to a basic wash, dry and curl, all of your hair needs will be met and exceeded. Each style does come with a warning though: it’s easy to trip over all those jaws that are still on the floor, so watch your step honey.

Don’t call it a comeback. Cupcakes never went out of style. Especially not Root Beer frosted Sugar Cookie Cupcakes from the Atlanta Cupcake Factory. With a fresh recipe and a knack for small-batch baking, the family-owned company is cranking up the confectionery heat. At $2.75 per cup, you’ll want to grab an array of classics (think Red Velvet) as well as some wildly inventive sweets (Chocolate Bacon Peanut Butter!) But take heed, the bakery often sells out, so come early!

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Since 1969 the DiBartolo family has been making the frosting fantasies of Collingswood cake lovers a reality. Sweet dreams at the bakery have been known to involve confectionery renderings like neon-laced Nike sneakers, dark and ominous Batman insignias and more traditional Tres Leches cakes. There are also plenty of single-serving confections like cookies, macarons and chocolate-frosted, cream-filled donuts to grab on the go. Though...we wouldn’t judge if you staged a faux engagement in order to order one of the white-laced wedding themed cakes.

Like any great city, Boston has a laundry list of inarguable staples. The Red Sox. Traffic. The Freedom Trail. Dirty water. Harvard. Pak the cah in Havad yad. Dennis Leary. And of course, seafood. Now there’s a tradition everyone can get behind. In fact, I know a place where the “Best in Boston” chowda comes in a fluffy bread bowl and the lobsters come fresh from Maine. Family owned and operated since 1987, the shop’s dedication to speedy seafood continues to keep them at the top of mind for lunch and dinner. Tourist or townie, claw cracker or soup sipper, there’s a dish for you at Boston Chowda. In the city? Head to the Pru location. North shoring it? North Andover is your shop!

Uno Dué Go is a marketplace restaurant with the best ingredient intentions. Heat up your lunch break with a locally-grown Harvest Vegetable stone-oven Pizza. Every speck of the salsa-ed surface is covered in lush broccoli, crisp peppers, aromatic basil and a hearty heap of cheese. What could top that? Only a sweet, sweet trip to the Greek Yogurt bar. Though the place is brimming with afternoon cravings, it’s never too early for a Uno Dué Go detour. The doors open at 6:30AM. And, a yawn is a just silent scream for coffee...organic fair-trade coffee.

Why be forced to decide among multiple good options? I prefer to live life like a hot buffet: indulge in a little bit of everything. Enter the New Asia on the block. I pile my plate with Spring Rolls, Spare Ribs, Dumplings, Rangoon and Mein (Lo and Chow.) But in order to keep indulging in all of life’s pleasures, it’s imperative to maintain a sensible budget. Sometimes I prefer to live life a la carte. That way I get exactly what I want: Roast Pork Egg Rolls ($1.20,) Wonton Soup ($1.40,) and Veggie Fried Rice ($3.25.)

Alright, rock-paper-scissors for who drives to Java Supreme. Wait, new game? Let’s hear it. A soy latte drowns falafel. Falafel crumbles pesto pasta. Pesto pasta out-scents free Wi-Fi. Wait a minute, in what world does falafel beat pesto pasta? Um, the one where the falafel is vegan, made-with-hummus and over-stuffed into a warm pita with veggies. Well how are we going to leave out the sandwich-salad combo for $5.50? Easy, that’s for when you don’t care who drives; you just want to get here ASAP, duh!

Nervously, I approach the Fond cake at Belle Cakery. I’ve had my share of tempting desserts here... delicate Brown Butter Apple Tartlets, hand-kneaded Olive Bread. But the Fond cake is something special. I blush as a slice reveals a side profile of its sweet layers: a strip of malted milk chocolate mousse. A sheet of cocoa sponge cake balanced on a crisp peanut base. Finally, a stratum of peanut butter-chocolate ganache. I stammer. “Would it be okay... can I... have a slice?” I enjoyed its layers under the cherry blossom tree outside. Maybe if I take home a whole cake, this feeling will last forever.

When the sun comes up, you can greet it in two ways: hurl vicious expletives towards the sky (and your alarm) or get revved up for breakfast at Julia’s of Wallingford. Sit on the patio and start off with Cinnamon Yum Yum buns: fresh from the on-site bakery and dipped in goey l’orange cream. Stay for dinner, or migrate to JW’s wild twin sister, Julia’s on Broadway! Friday nights call for dinner & the Le Faux show, featuring celebrity impersonators and drag queens! Throw back a few drinks, dance with divas and be sure to be on your worst behavior... Just remember who the REAL queens of the stage are!

FORE! Speeding toward the streets of Seattle like an off-kilter golf ball is Happy Grillmore, a burger-based food truck with a delicious menu named after Sandler sidekicks. The Chubs is not gator-based, but the angus beef burg does pack a hell of a bite with red pepper aioli and spicy mustard. Cue the antagonist! Weighing in at ¼ lb. is The Shooter Burger. Just like McGavin, it’s ridiculously aggressive. Granted it is a black bean burger, you know...to stay trim for the Pro Golf Tour. Even when you pile on a side fries, Bob Barker will tell you that the price is right. Track the truck, we guarantee that it will make you...Happy.

Asa Sushi has created its own language to deliver original works of art from their counter to your mouth. For instance, did you know that “OMG” translates to deep fried unagi, crab and avocado with shrimp, tuna and spicy scallop? Or that the risqué sounding Booty Booty roll holds tuna, crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, and cream cheese? For those seeking familiar vocab, there’s plentiful udon, donburi and teriyaki. But then, what better way to honor your city than a yellowtail, scallion and tobiko translated Golden Gate Roll?

The folks at Fazenda may have pulled an Inception on me, because this is my café dream come true. On Level 1, Sweets like Vegan Chocolate Cake and Pumpkin Whoopie Pie are baked in-house every morning. Latin American and African coffee beans are roasted daily for the freshest possible brew. When there’s time to enter Level 2, I bring my totem, the Lemon Pepper Tofu sandwich with hummus, olive tapenade, green pepper, and spinach on a warm ciabatta roll. An elegant solution for keeping track of reality.

I let him know... if I ever see that lame sandwich again, I’m hitting him with a swift Firecracker Shrimp roundhouse kick. See what’s poppin’ with the art of Asian Persuasion @AsianFoodTruck.

Ada’s Technical Books is cementing Capitol Hill’s geek-chic reputation. Shelved with tech, math and science-centric reads, this locally-owned shop lures decorated intellectuals and curious thinkers alike. Swing by to peruse (there are plenty of nooks to hack) or pop by with a purpose (the expert curators can help you find any obscurity.) What good is a paperback palace without a stiff beverage? Since coffee is for the common bookster, Ada’s doles out a beverage fit for a scientist. Club-Mate is a heavily caffeinated soda-tea hybrid. And, Ada’s is the only place you can nab it in Washington. #RareFind.

“Cheeburger! Cheeburger!” That’s the response I get from my kids when I ask what they want for dinner. So I place my hand theatrically on my hip and shoot a stern look of disapproval their way, all the while I’m salivating at the thought of a cold beer and a half-pound 100% Angus burger with my choice of toppings. At this point, I’m only fooling myself. Finally, the thought crispy fries and zesty horseradish dipping sauce puts me over the edge, and I succumb, “just this once.”

Lucid dreaming: it’s a fantasy I control. I swoop into Lakeview at 2AM on Saturday (I’m an owl in my dreams,) and start to build my perfect slice. Pie Hole Pizza Joint has all the tools: caramelized onions, red pesto sauce and a 6-cheese blend of mozzarella, provolone, cheddar, gouda, feta and parmesan. My mind is spinning, my taste buds twerking. The kids next to me are eating the After-School Special: sausage, cheese and marshmallows. I’ll dream of breakfast next...

Coco Jazz Salon in University City is a place of restoration and relaxation, but it’s also the place you go to when you wanna make a bold statement! Switch things up with a cut that’s sassy, short and sleek. If you want to take it down a notch, the weave techs can rapunzel your hairstyle so you leave with long, luscious locks. From hair coloring to a basic wash, dry and curl, all of your hair needs will be met and exceeded. Each style does come with a warning though: it’s easy to trip over all those jaws that are still on the floor, so watch your step honey.

Don’t call it a comeback. Cupcakes never went out of style. Especially not Root Beer frosted Sugar Cookie Cupcakes from the Atlanta Cupcake Factory. With a fresh recipe and a knack for small-batch baking, the family-owned company is cranking up the confectionery heat. At $2.75 per cup, you’ll want to grab an array of classics (think Red Velvet) as well as some wildly inventive sweets (Chocolate Bacon Peanut Butter!) But take heed, the bakery often sells out, so come early!

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Tune of Under The Boardwalk: Oh when the cheese falls down, and bubbles over discs of pepperoni. And though it tastes so good, your slice of BBQ Ranch could you loan me? Under the Boardwalk, Grill & Pizzeriiiiaaa, yeah. With a pizza and a cheesesteak, is where I’ll be. (Under the boardwalk) lunch specials ‘till three! (Under the boardwalk) French Fryz are hand-cut with ease. (Under the boardwalk) Chicken Parm, Turkey Club. (Under the boardwalk) Seafood on pizza or a sub. Under the boardwalk, boardwalk.

Since 1969 the DiBartolo family has been making the frosting fantasies of Collingswood cake lovers a reality. Sweet dreams at the bakery have been known to involve confectionery renderings like neon-laced Nike sneakers, dark and ominous Batman insignias and more traditional Tres Leches cakes. There are also plenty of single-serving confections like cookies, macarons and chocolate-frosted, cream-filled donuts to grab on the go. Though...we wouldn’t judge if you staged a faux engagement in order to order one of the white-laced wedding themed cakes.

Like any great city, Boston has a laundry list of inarguable staples. The Red Sox. Traffic. The Freedom Trail. Dirty water. Harvard. Pak the cah in Havad yad. Dennis Leary. And of course, seafood. Now there’s a tradition everyone can get behind. In fact, I know a place where the “Best in Boston” chowda comes in a fluffy bread bowl and the lobsters come fresh from Maine. Family owned and operated since 1987, the shop’s dedication to speedy seafood continues to keep them at the top of mind for lunch and dinner. Tourist or townie, claw cracker or soup sipper, there’s a dish for you at Boston Chowda. In the city? Head to the Pru location. North shoring it? North Andover is your shop!

Uno Dué Go is a marketplace restaurant with the best ingredient intentions. Heat up your lunch break with a locally-grown Harvest Vegetable stone-oven Pizza. Every speck of the salsa-ed surface is covered in lush broccoli, crisp peppers, aromatic basil and a hearty heap of cheese. What could top that? Only a sweet, sweet trip to the Greek Yogurt bar. Though the place is brimming with afternoon cravings, it’s never too early for a Uno Dué Go detour. The doors open at 6:30AM. And, a yawn is a just silent scream for coffee...organic fair-trade coffee.

Why be forced to decide among multiple good options? I prefer to live life like a hot buffet: indulge in a little bit of everything. Enter the New Asia on the block. I pile my plate with Spring Rolls, Spare Ribs, Dumplings, Rangoon and Mein (Lo and Chow.) But in order to keep indulging in all of life’s pleasures, it’s imperative to maintain a sensible budget. Sometimes I prefer to live life a la carte. That way I get exactly what I want: Roast Pork Egg Rolls ($1.20,) Wonton Soup ($1.40,) and Veggie Fried Rice ($3.25.)

Alright, rock-paper-scissors for who drives to Java Supreme. Wait, new game? Let’s hear it. A soy latte drowns falafel. Falafel crumbles pesto pasta. Pesto pasta out-scents free Wi-Fi. Wait a minute, in what world does falafel beat pesto pasta? Um, the one where the falafel is vegan, made-with-hummus and over-stuffed into a warm pita with veggies. Well how are we going to leave out the sandwich-salad combo for $5.50? Easy, that’s for when you don't care who drives; you just want to get here ASAP, duh!

Nervously, I approach the Fond cake at Belle Cakery. I’ve had my share of tempting desserts here... delicate Brown Butter Apple Tartlets, hand-kneaded Olive Bread. But the Fond cake is something special. I blush as a slice reveals a side profile of its sweet layers: a strip of malted milk chocolate mousse. A sheet of cocoa sponge cake balanced on a crisp peanut base. Finally, a stratum of peanut butter-chocolate ganache. I stammer. “Would it be okay... can I... have a slice?” I enjoyed its layers under the cherry blossom tree outside. Maybe if I take home a whole cake, this feeling will last forever.

When the sun comes up, you can greet it in two ways: hurl vicious expletives towards the sky (and your alarm) or get revved up for breakfast at Julia’s of Wallingford. Sit on the patio and start off with Cinnamon Yum Yum buns: fresh from the on-site bakery and dipped in goey l’orange cream. Stay for dinner, or migrate to JW’s wild twin sister, Julia’s on Broadway! Friday nights call for dinner & the Le Faux show, featuring celebrity impersonators and drag queens! Throw back a few drinks, dance with divas and be sure to be on your worst behavior... Just remember who the REAL queens of the stage are!

FORE! Speeding toward the streets of Seattle like an off-kilter golf ball is Happy Grillmore, a burger-based food truck with a delicious menu named after Sandler sidekicks. The Chubs is not gator-based, but the angus beef burg does pack a hell of a bite with red pepper aioli and spicy mustard. Cue the antagonist! Weighing in at ¼ lb. is The Shooter Burger. Just like McGavin, it’s ridiculously aggressive. Granted it is a black bean burger, you know...to stay trim for the Pro Golf Tour. Even when you pile on a side fries, Bob Barker will tell you that the price is right. Track the truck, we guarantee that it will make you...Happy.

Asa Sushi has created its own language to deliver original works of art from their counter to your mouth. For instance, did you know that “OMG” translates to deep fried unagi, crab and avocado with shrimp, tuna and spicy scallop? Or that the risqué sounding Booty Booty roll holds tuna, crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, and cream cheese? For those seeking familiar vocab, there’s plentiful udon, donburi and teriyaki. But then, what better way to honor your city than a yellowtail, scallion and tobiko translated Golden Gate Roll?
